relation: Security is on campus 24/7 and has a phone number you can call anytime if you feel threatened or in danger. They will also escort you to your car during the evening when it is dark. A safety report is sent via email to all students and staff and is available via Alverno's website. Doors are locked at 2200.

Fun can be defined in many different ways. Alverno is highly involved in the community and employs opportunities for getting involved via email, posters hung around the campus, and word of mouth. There are always activities that gain the interest of the diverse population, whether it is on campus or off.

There is a variety of food choices that can be selected from a deli, salad bar, grill, and/or a hot entree choice. There is always a vegetarian option and the sodium content is minimal. The disposable utensils are made from recycled material and food scraps are composted.
I have not experienced this, but have talked with other individuals about their experiences. My rating is based off of what they have told me.

Alverno's learning experience is based on eight abilities that are essential for success after earning your degree. Educational courses are designed to help students achieve these abilities with confidence and using their critical thinking skills. Professor and student feedback are important for success in available courses, as well as self-assessment.

You will benefit from the challenges you face throughout you time at Alverno. Your will be molded into someone who learns from multiple sources (self-assessment, feedback from others, personal experience) and someone who is confident about being successful in the future despite previous failures.

Alverno is a college of excellence with a variety of opportunities for students. The warm atmosphere at Alverno supports open minded individuals willing to share ideas with each other to attain goal achievement. Class size is small compared to other universities, so there is a greater opportunity to meet with professors on an individual basis.
pageTitle: Alverno College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex

The class sizes are small which makes it easier for students to connect with their professors. And The professors are all highly educated in their field of study. Alverno was also, ranked the #1 college in the Midwest last year 2011., 81517=Alverno College has a unique 8 ability-based curriculum that challenges its female undergraduates to demonstrate mastery in each core sections. Bachlor degree programs are available traditionally throughout the week and non-traditionally offering weekend and weeknight classes. US News & World Reports ranks Alverno No. 1 in educating undergrads for both 2011 and 2012; totaling 27 listings since 1983., 177649=Ew. They try, but fail. The commons food is over-priced, over-cooked, and unhealthy. I hated that I was required to spend $2000 on a meal plan for that crap and then had a ton of money left over at the end of the semester to buy bulk with., 157066=There are many. This college is very diverse. We have the ball in December (our theme this year was Bollywood). We have a hi-jab day, a day of fast, etc. There are many group discussions that you can attend which actually are very informative and fun, they invite professors and/or speakers to lead them such as feminism and sex trafficking in the world, even dating., 187055=There are so many things to do. Comedy Sportz, Henna Tattoos, Alverno Idols (similar to American Idol), Miss Alverno 2013, Homecoming Week, We have so many organizations to be involved in History Club, and BSU... The list goes on...}

textAfterTable: Categories Comments Great for these types of students Students that like smaller, more hands-on classes. Those who would not like to be in a 300-student lecture hall, but rather a 20-student classroom. Bang for the buck It is more expensive since it's a private school, but I think in the long run it'll be worth it! Am enjoying being here Everyone is very friendly, and with it being an all women's college, everyone is very supportive! Am learning a lot They definitely challenge you & push you outside of your comfort zone! It may seem awkward at first, but I just finished my 1st semester here & I look back and realize how much I've grown already. Login to rate or flag the reviews Dasmarie from Milwaukee, WI 10/29/2009 Reviewer is Researching this school. Reviewer has been to campus. 4 out of 5 people found this review useful. 3 of 54
